definition: the science or art of ordering tones or sounds in succession, in combination, and in temporal relationships to produce a composition having unity and continuity

vocal, instrumental, or mechanical sounds having rhythm, melody, or harmony                                      
             
             choral music

an agreeable sound : euphony                                      
             
             her voice was music to my ears

musical quality                                      
             
             the music of verse

a musical accompaniment                                      
             
             a play set to music

the score (see score entry 1 sense 6a) of a musical composition set down on paper                                      
             
             leafing through the music

a distinctive type or category of music                                      
             
             there is a music for everybody
sounds that are sung by voices or played on musical instruments
written or printed symbols showing how music should be played or sung
the art or skill of creating or performing music

an arrangement of sounds having melody, rhythm, and usually harmony                                      
             
             classical music

the art of producing pleasing or expressive combinations of tones especially with melody, rhythm, and usually harmony                                      
             
             I want to study music in college.

a musical composition set down on paper                                      
             
             Bring your music.

a pleasing sound                                      
             
             Your voice is music to my ears.
in: choral music
piano music
recorded music
her voice was music to my ears
the music of a nightingale
the music of verse
the music of lovingly orchestrated words
a play set to music
leafing through the music
there is a music for everybody
rock music
jazz music
classical music

performing music in front of an audience
dancing to the music of a big band
They are writing music for a new album.
a song with music by George Gershwin and words by Ira Gershwin

She studied music in college.
I want to study music in college.
Bring your music.
Your voice is music to my ears.

definition: sounds made by voices or instruments arranged in a way that is pleasant to listen to
the art or activity of writing, performing, or studying music
the printed symbols that represent the sounds of music that musicians or singers read when they are performing
a book or sheet of paper with music printed on it, used by a performer
in: She prefers listening to classical music.
write/compose music: He’s written music for several film soundtracks.
a piece of music: We need to rehearse a new piece of music for the concert.
She’s planning to do a degree in music.
Music is his whole life.
read music  (=understand what sounds the symbols represent): I’m learning to read music.
I must have left my music on the piano.
music to your ears

definition: a pattern of sounds made by musical instruments, voices, or computers, or a combination of these, intended to give pleasure to people listening to it:
the art or study of music:
the written system of symbols representing musical notes:
a pattern of sounds made by instruments or by singing or by a combination of both, or the written symbols representing these sounds:
